page.title: 19MORETON ONE DAY SHOW
page.content: The{Moreton show}started in 1880 as a Horse Show. In 1948 it joined with other local shows to become{The} {Moreton-in-Marsh District Agricultural {and Horse Show.}The site covers over 67 acres and is one of the largest one day shows in the country. There are about 1,000 members. Each year, members included, about 20,000 people visit the show. There are over 1,000 people that enter the various competitions. There are over 300 {animals classes,}apart from horses, to be entered in the show. There are 2 major{horse}classes, attracting about 400 horses to enter. There are about 200 trade exhibitions. Attractions in recent years have included a High Diving Aquatic Show and a Falconry Display. There is a{Show Jumping Competition}which attracts the country's best riders.
